sentences.sentence: The Selfish( 自私的 ) Giant( 巨人 )
Every afternoon, on their way home from school, the children used to go and play in the Giant( 巨人 )’s garden.
It was a large lovely garden, with soft green grass.
Here and there over the grass grew beautiful flowers like stars.
There were twelve peach( 桃子 ) trees that were pink and white in springtime and full of sweet fruit in the autumn.
The birds sat on the trees and sang, so sweetly that the children would stop playing and just listen to them.
“How happy we are here!” they cried to each other.
One day the Giant( 巨人 ) came back.
He had been to visit his friend, who was also a giant( 巨人 ).
He had stayed with his friend for seven years.
After the seven years were over, they had nothing else to talk about, and so the Giant( 巨人 ) decided to return home.
When he arrived back home, he saw the children playing in his garden.
“What are you doing here?” he shouted in an angry voice, and the children ran away.
“My own garden is my own garden,” said the Giant( 巨人 ).
“Anyone can understand that, and I will not allow anybody to play in it but myself.”
So he built a high wall all around it, and put up a sign.
TRESPASSERS( 擅闯者 ) WILL BE PROSECUTED( 被起诉 )
He was a very selfish( 自私的 ) Giant( 巨人 ).
The poor children now had nowhere to play.
They tried to play on the road, but the road was very dirty and full of hard stones, and they did not like it.
After school, they used to walk around the high wall, and talk about the beautiful garden inside.
“How happy we were there,” they said to each other.
Then the Spring came, and all over the country there were little flowers and little birds.
Only in the garden of the Selfish( 自私的 ) Giant( 巨人 ) was it still winter.
The birds did not want to sing there anymore because there were no children, and the trees forgot to grow their leaves.
One time a beautiful flower pushed its head out from the grass,
but when it saw the Giant( 巨人 )’s sign, it felt sorry for the children, and went back to sleep again in the ground.
The only people who were pleased with the garden were the Snow and the Frost( 霜 ).
“Spring has forgotten this garden,” they said, “so we will live here all year long.”
The Snow covered up the grass with her great white coat, and the Frost( 霜 ) painted all the trees silver.
Then they invited the North Wind to stay with them, and he came.
He roared( 呼啸 ) all day through the garden, and blew and blew until the Giant( 巨人 )’s windows shook.
“This is a wonderful place,” he said, “we must ask the Hail( 冰雹 ) to visit.”
So the Hail( 冰雹 ) came.
Every day for three hours he knocked on the roof( 屋顶 ) of the Giant( 巨人 )’s house.
Then he ran around the garden as fast as he could.
He was dressed in grey, and his breath( 呼吸 ) was like ice.
“I cannot understand why the Spring is so late this year,” said the Selfish( 自私的 ) Giant( 巨人 ), as he looked out at his cold white garden.
“I hope the weather will change soon.”
But the Spring never came, nor the Summer.
The Autumn gave golden fruit to every garden, but to the Giant( 巨人 )’s garden she gave none.
“He is too selfish( 自私的 ),” she said.
It was always Winter in the Giant( 巨人 )’s garden, and the North Wind, the Hail( 冰雹 ), the Frost( 霜 ), and the Snow danced through the trees.
One morning the Giant( 巨人 ) was lying awake in bed, when he heard some lovely music.
It sounded so sweet that he thought it must be the King’s musicians passing by( 经过 ).
It was really only a little bird singing outside his window,
but he had not heard a bird sing in his garden for so long that to him this sounded like the most beautiful music in the world.
Then the Hail( 冰雹 ) stopped dancing over his head, and the North Wind stopped roaring( 呼啸 ).
A delicious smell came to him through the open window.
“I believe the Spring has come at last,” said the Giant( 巨人 ), and he jumped out of bed and looked out.
What did he see?
He saw a wonderful sight.
Through a little hole in the wall the children had climbed into his garden.
They were sitting in the branches( 树枝 ) of the trees, so that in every tree that he could see there was a little child.
The trees were so glad to have the children back again that they covered themselves with flowers, and were moving their arms gently back and forth( 来回地 ) above the children’s heads.
The birds were also flying around and singing happily, and the flowers were looking up through the green grass and laughing.
It was a lovely scene.

article_info.previous: 矮人进入一间带镜子的房间，看着镜子里的怪物形象，矮人猛然意识到那正是自己。原来公主为他露出的笑容并不是因为喜欢他，而是被他滑稽的外表给逗乐了。念及此处，矮人心碎一地，遂倒地不起，一命呜呼。我们送走矮人，接下来一起认识下自私的巨人。

question.cn: 当小朋友都在花园里玩的时候，巨人的花园是什么样的？
question.en: How was the Giant's garden when there were many children there?

analysis: 文中提到“Every afternoon, on their way home from school, the children used to go and play in the Giant’s garden.It was a large lovely garden, with soft green grass.” 因此本题选A。

question.cn: 巨人回家之后做了什么？
question.en: What did the Giant do when he came back?

options.cn: 他邀请朋友们去他的花园。
options.en: He invited some of his friends to his garden.

options.cn: 他允许一些小孩在他的花园玩耍。
options.en: He allowed some children to play in his garden.

options.cn: 他禁止任何小朋友在他的花园玩耍。
options.en: He didn't allow any children to enter his garden.

analysis: 文中提到“When he arrived back home, he saw the children playing in his garden. . . ‘My own garden is my own garden,’ said the Giant. ‘Anyone can understand that, and I will not allow anybody to play in it but myself.’”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 为什么巨人的花园里仍然是冬天？
question.en: Why was it still winter in the Giant's garden?

options.cn: 因为这个国家没有春天。
options.en: Because there was no spring in the country.

options.cn: 因为花园里没有小孩了。

analysis: 文中提到“Only in the garden of the Selfish Giant was it still winter. The birds did not want to sing there anymore because there were no children, and the trees forgot to grow their leaves.”因为没有小孩，春天也忘记光临这个花园，因此本题选C。

question.cn: 巨人在早上听到了什么？
question.en: What did the Giant hear in the morning?

options.cn: 国王的乐师在演奏音乐。
一个小孩在唱着动听的歌。
options.en: A child was singing a sweet song.
A bird was singing outside his window.
